Description: Low conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; exterior: reserved band at junction of bowl and foot; glazed black (almost completely worn) below; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding squat patterned chalices, see Lemos no. 1062 from Kamiros. The number in Petrie's catalogue, '41', is written in pencil on the underside of the foot.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 41)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1083) (phase 2)
